title: Microsoft 365 Messaging MS - 203
subtitle: A master course designed for working professionals like you. Make your career soar with Loyal Bytes.

courseDetail.certification: DP â€“ 203 and Data Engineering on Microsoft Azure

highlights.heading: Learning mode
highlights.subheading: Group, One-to-One, Corporate Batches, Online Live Classrooms

courseDetail.description: Microsoft 365 Messaging Administrators deploy, configure, manage, troubleshoot, and monitor recipients, compliance, threat protection, and mail flow in hybrid and cloud enterprise environments.This learning path is designed to help you prepare for Microsoft's AZ-700 Designing and Implementing Microsoft Azure Networking Solutions exam. People who pass the AZ-700 exam will earn the Microsoft Certified: Azure Network Engineer Associate certification. The AZ-700 exam tests your knowledge of five subject areas: designing, implementing, and managing hybrid networking, designing, and implementing core networking infrastructure, designing, and implementing routing, securing and monitoring networks, and designing and implementing private access to Azure services.

idealFor: Candidates for this exam are messaging administrators who deploy, configure, manage, troubleshoot, and monitor recipients, compliance, threat protection, and mail flow in hybrid and cloud enterprise environments. Messaging administrators are responsible for managing message hygiene, permissions, messaging infrastructure, hybrid configuration, migration, transport, mailboxes, and client access. Messaging administrators collaborate with other workload administrators and the Microsoft 365 enterprise administrator to implement a secure hybrid or cloud-only messaging topology that meets the business needs of an enterprise. The messaging administrator should have a working knowledge of authentication types, licensing, and integration with Microsoft 365 applications
learningObjectives: Create beautiful web flow. Learn how to migrate and host on Microsoft Azure

modules.title: Module 1: MANAGE ORGANIZATIONAL SETTINGS AND RESOURCES (30-35%)

submodules.heading: PLAN AND MANAGE ORGANIZATIONAL SETTINGS
contents: Manage a Global Address List (GAL), including hierarchical address books (HAB)
Plan and configure organization relationships and individual sharing
Manage add-ins from Microsoft 365 Admin Center

submodules.heading: PLAN AND MANAGE CLIENT ACCESS
contents: Configure virtual directories and urls in a hybrid environment
Configure global outlook on the web policies

submodules.heading: 9.1.3	MANAGE RECIPIENT RESOURCES
contents: Manage groups including distribution lists, dynamic distribution lists, mail-enabled security groups, and microsoft 365 groups
Manage shared mailboxes, including converting to a shared mailbox
Create and manage contacts, including mail contacts and mail users
Manage email addresses for microsoft teams

modules.title: Module 2: PLAN AND MANAGE THE MAIL TRANSPORT ARCHITECTURE (20-25%)

submodules.heading: PLAN AND CONFIGURE CONNECTORS
contents: Plan connectors to route or secure mail flow
Create and configure connectors to route mail
Create and configure connectors to secure mail flow between organizations
Create and configure conditional mail routing

submodules.heading: TROUBLESHOOT MAIL FLOW
contents: Troubleshoot by using the microsoft remote connectivity analyzer
Troubleshoot by using the microsoft support and recovery assistant
Troubleshoot by using transport logs and queues in a hybrid environment

modules.title: Module 3: PLAN AND IMPLEMENT A HYBRID CONFIGURATION AND MIGRATION (15-20%)

submodules.heading: PLAN AND IMPLEMENT A HYBRID ENVIRONMENT
contents: Plan a hybrid deployment by using the Hybrid Configuration Wizard (HCW)manage the Edge server role in a hybrid environment
Configure the environment by using the Hybrid Configuration Wizard
Manage the Exchange certificates lifecycle in a hybrid environment

submodules.heading: PLAN AND IMPLEMENT MIGRATION
contents: Evaluate migration methods, including cutover, minimal hybrid (express migration), cutover, cross tenant, staged, PST Imports, IMAP, Google Workspace (formerly G-Suite), batch migration by using the Exchange admin center
Plan a public folder migration to Microsoft 365

submodules.heading: MANAGE ROLE-BASED PERMISSIONS IN EXCHANGE
contents: Assign user accounts to admin roles

submodules.heading: MANAGE MESSAGE HYGIENE
contents: Plan and configure spam confidence levels (scl)
Add and manage dns records for domains
Validate settings by using configuration analyzer

submodules.heading: MANAGE COMPLIANCE
contents: Configure retention labels and retention policies
Manage core ediscovery cases (not including advanced ediscovery)

onCompletion: The bullets that follow each of the skills measured are intended to illustrate how we are assessing that skill. Related topics may not be covered in the exam.
Most questions cover features that are general availability (GA). The exam may contain questions on Preview features if those features are commonly used.
